key_points: Concerns were raised about 24-year-old armorer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed's carelessness with guns on a prior film set.
Gutierrez-Reed was the armorer on the set of Alec Baldwin's film 'Rust' where a fatal shooting occurred.
Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was fatally struck, and director Joel Souza was injured when Baldwin discharged a prop gun.
Rust production sources cited the accident as resulting from overall failings, including budget and safety measures.
There were at least two prior incidents of accidental gun discharges on the 'Rust' set.
Assistant director Dave Halls, who declared the gun "cold," is deemed partially responsible for not adequately checking the weapon.
Gutierrez-Reed is described as inexperienced, with 'Rust' being one of her first jobs as head armorer.
Complaints about safety practices and previous gun misfires were made to the 'Rust' production team.
Film's production company is criticized for cost-cutting measures that compromised safety.
Prop gun safety expert Richard Howell emphasized the armorer's responsibility for weapons safety on set.
